SummaryEnglish: Hiromu Arakawa, before becoming a manga artist, spent seven years on her family's Hokkaido farm, enduring a tough life with daily challenges. She worked year-round, tending to cows and crops, and facing local wildlife. Her experiences reflect the hard realities of Japanese farming, yet also highlight the admirable and humorous resilience of those who work the land.
SummaryJapanese: 物語は荒川さんが漫画家になる前の7年間、北海道で農家として働いた後の話です。 この経験は、農業学校の生徒を中心とした彼女の銀のスプーン漫画の仕事に最終的に影響を与えました。
